segment.source: 4932(S) Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.
segment.target: 4932(S) Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4932(S) Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.
segment.target: Describes security event 4932(S) Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.

segment.source: 4932(S): Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.
segment.target: 4932(S): Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates every time synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.
segment.target: This event generates every time synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: Active Directory domain controller.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: Active Directory domain controller.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Destination DRA Type = UnicodeString: destination directory replication agent distinguished name.
segment.target: Destination DRA Type = UnicodeString: destination directory replication agent distinguished name.

segment.source: Note The Directory Replication Agent (DRA) handles replication between domain controllers.
segment.target: Note The Directory Replication Agent (DRA) handles replication between domain controllers.

segment.source: The Directory Replication Agent uses the connection objects in the topology map to find out those partners that are relevant when replicating changes to directory partitions.
segment.target: The Directory Replication Agent uses the connection objects in the topology map to find out those partners that are relevant when replicating changes to directory partitions.

segment.source: The DRA sends a replication request to the partners of a domain controller when the domain controller needs to update its copy of Active Directory.
segment.target: The DRA sends a replication request to the partners of a domain controller when the domain controller needs to update its copy of Active Directory.

segment.source: Source DRA Type = UnicodeString: source directory replication agent distinguished name.
segment.target: Source DRA Type = UnicodeString: source directory replication agent distinguished name.

segment.source: Note The LDAP API references an LDAP object by its distinguished name (DN).
segment.target: Note The LDAP API references an LDAP object by its distinguished name (DN).

segment.source: A DN is a sequence of relative distinguished names (RDN) connected by commas.
segment.target: A DN is a sequence of relative distinguished names (RDN) connected by commas.

segment.source: An RDN is an attribute with an associated value in the form attribute=value; .
segment.target: An RDN is an attribute with an associated value in the form attribute=value; .

segment.source: These are examples of RDNs attributes:
segment.target: These are examples of RDNs attributes:

segment.source: • DC - domainComponent
segment.target: • DC - domainComponent

segment.source: • CN - commonName
segment.target: • CN - commonName

segment.source: • OU - organizationalUnitName
segment.target: • OU - organizationalUnitName

segment.source: • O - organizationName
segment.target: • O - organizationName

segment.source: Naming Context Type = UnicodeString: naming context to replicate.
segment.target: Naming Context Type = UnicodeString: naming context to replicate.

segment.source: Note The Directory Tree of Active Directory tree is partitioned to allow sections to be distributed (replicated) to domain controllers in different domains within the forest.
segment.target: Note The Directory Tree of Active Directory tree is partitioned to allow sections to be distributed (replicated) to domain controllers in different domains within the forest.

segment.source: Each domain controller stores a copy of a specific part of the directory tree, called a Naming Context also known as Directory Partition.
segment.target: Each domain controller stores a copy of a specific part of the directory tree, called a Naming Context also known as Directory Partition.

segment.source: Naming Context is replicated as a unit to other domain controllers in the forest that contain a replica of the same sub tree.
segment.target: Naming Context is replicated as a unit to other domain controllers in the forest that contain a replica of the same sub tree.

segment.source: A Naming Context is also called a Directory Partition.
segment.target: A Naming Context is also called a Directory Partition.

segment.source: Options Type = UInt32: decimal value of DRS Options.
segment.target: Options Type = UInt32: decimal value of DRS Options.

segment.source: Session ID Type = UInt32: unique identifier of replication session.
segment.target: Session ID Type = UInt32: unique identifier of replication session.

segment.source: Using this field you can find “4932: Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.”
segment.target: Using this field you can find “4932: Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.”

segment.source: and “4933: Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has ended.”
segment.target: and “4933: Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has ended.”

segment.source: events for the same session.
segment.target: events for the same session.

segment.source: Start USN Type = UnicodeString: Naming Context’s USN number before replication begins.
segment.target: Start USN Type = UnicodeString: Naming Context’s USN number before replication begins.

segment.source: Note Active Directory replication does not depend on time to determine what changes need to be propagated.
segment.target: Note Active Directory replication does not depend on time to determine what changes need to be propagated.

segment.source: It relies instead on the use of update sequence numbers (USNs) that are assigned by a counter that is local to each domain controller.
segment.target: It relies instead on the use of update sequence numbers (USNs) that are assigned by a counter that is local to each domain controller.

segment.source: Because these USN counters are local, it is easy to ensure that they are reliable and never "run backward" (that is, decrease in value).
segment.target: Because these USN counters are local, it is easy to ensure that they are reliable and never "run backward" (that is, decrease in value).

segment.source: The trade-off is that it is meaningless to compare a USN assigned on one domain controller to a USN assigned on a different domain controller.
segment.target: The trade-off is that it is meaningless to compare a USN assigned on one domain controller to a USN assigned on a different domain controller.

segment.source: The replication system is designed with this restriction in mind.
segment.target: The replication system is designed with this restriction in mind.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4932(S): Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.
segment.target: For 4932(S): Synchronization of a replica of an Active Directory naming context has begun.

segment.source: Monitor for Source Address field, because the source of replication (DRA) must be authorized for this action.
segment.target: Monitor for Source Address field, because the source of replication (DRA) must be authorized for this action.

segment.source: If you find any unauthorized DRA you should trigger an event.
segment.target: If you find any unauthorized DRA you should trigger an event.

segment.source: This event is typically used for Active Directory replication troubleshooting.
segment.target: This event is typically used for Active Directory replication troubleshooting.
